intro: Ferulago nodiflora, commonly known as the clustered ferulago, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid soils and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, often spicy scent. Ferulago nodiflora is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
